TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DiscoverySearchPattern extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Establishes an interface for file extension search patterns for discoverable file types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument.References%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to add a discoverable file type to a Web services document. While a discovery document is usually serialized as a file using a .disco extension, you can add multiple files to the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument.References%2A> property, and those files can have other extensions, represented by implementations of DiscoverySearchPattern .
The DiscoverySearchPattern class and its concrete derived classes are employed by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler> class's <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler.ProcessRequest%2A> method, which handles an HTTP request for a discovery document. Normally, none of these classes need to be used directly by a developer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference GetDiscoveryReference(string filename) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of a discovery file or a file that appears in a dynamically generated discovery document. For example, an .asmx or .xsd file.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the object for a given file name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A class derived from <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoverySearchPattern> implements the GetDiscoveryReference method by returning its associated concrete class derived from <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryReference>.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractSearchPattern> class returns a <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.ContractReference> instance that contains the location of an .asmx Web service file and the corresponding dynamically generated Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document.

Docs.summary: Gets the file name pattern to use as a search target.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The pattern typically specifies a file name extension, for example, .disco or .asmx.
